She received her doctorate in Pharmacology and Toxicology with a minor in Microbiology and Immunology from the University of Arizona in 2003. She uses her interdisciplinary training to apply the scientific method to controversial topics. Dr. Beischel’s research mainly focuses on people who report experiencing regular communication with the deceased (mediums) and those who receive mediumship readings (sitters); specifically, the accuracy and specificity of the information mediums report; their experiences, psychology, and physiology; and the potential social applications of mediumship readings. Dr. Beischel is the author of the e-books Among Mediums: A Scientist’s Quest for Answers and Meaningful Messages: Making the Most of Your Mediumship Reading and editor of the e-series From the Mouths of Mediums: Conversations with Windbridge Certified Research Mediums. She is also the author of the paperback book Investigating Mediums. Dr. Beischel serves on the scientific advisory boards of the Rhine Research Center and the Forever Family Foundation.

Debra received her Masters of Intuition Medicine Certification in 1995 from the Academy of Intuition Medicine and completed her Masters Degree in Counseling Psychology from Dominican University in 2004. While working with numerous children, adults, couples and families to achieve their goals to enrich their relationships, Debra trained in grief counseling and became a certified Spiritual Director. She received her license as a Marriage Family Therapist in 2007. Prior to becoming a psychotherapist Debra practiced family and civil law for more than a decade in San Francisco and Marin County. Debra sees private clients in her Kentfield, California office.

Dr. Benor founded The Doctor-Healer Network in England. After 10 years in England he returned to work in New Jersey, USA. He is the author of Healing Research; is editor and publisher of International Journal of Healing and Caring - On Line an informational website on spiritual awareness, healing and Complementary and Alternative Medicine research.

He is a Founding Diplomate of the American Board of Holistic Medicine, Coordinator for the Council for Healing, a non-profit organization that promotes awareness of spiritual healing. Dr Benor is on the advisory boards of the journals, Alternative Therapies in Health and Medicine, International Society for the Study of Subtle Energy and Energy Medicine, Frontier Sciences, the Advisory Council of the Association for Comprehensive Energy Psychotherapy, Emotional Freedom Techniques and the Advisory Board of the Research Council for Complementary Medicine, Core reviewer for BioMed Central, Complementary and Alternative Medicine ­ On line.

She began her journey in psychology as a student of Jungian theory and has focused her interests on personality and the process of individuation. She received training directly from Dr. Carl Rogers in his "client-centered approach" to psychotherapy and has studied and worked with other leaders in the field of clinical and personality psychology.

Through her research Dr. Bradley develops psychological assessment methods and applies these to the study of adult development, wisdom and the creative personality. Her research is published in numerous scientific journals and she is co-author of the professional manual for the California Psychological Inventory (CPI).

Dr. Bradley is currently a research psychologist at the University of California at Berkeley and does private consulting. And, in addition to serving on the Academy's Advisory Board, Dr. Bradley is part of the faculty of the Academy, teaching a course on the CPI.

He has successfully managed merger, acquisition, reorganization, financing, joint venture, bankruptcy and problem asset engagements. He is the co-founder and President of Independent Exchange Services, Inc. and Reverse Exchange Services, Inc.; and co-founded the predecessor consulting company to Bunje Lloyd & Co. Ralph would describe himself as a “philosopher disguised as a financial consultant“ who uses many intuitive and holistic strategies to assist clients in developing practical solutions to their business and financial problems.

Ralph is presently on the board of directors for the Federation of Exchange Accommodators a 1031 exchange industry trade association. As the longest serving board member of the FEA he has held every office and is currently Chair of the Ethics Committee. He is a past board member of ANACOMP, INC., Wedgewood Technology, Inc., and XCELL Foods, Inc. He was also a regional director of the Northern California Association of Lloyd’s of London Members.

He was a professorial lecturer at Golden Gate University Graduate School of Accounting. Ralph is a retired U.S. Navy Commander with 25 years of service in the Naval Reserve.

As Caroline Myss wrote in her Foreword to Energy Medicine (Donna’s now classic book, translated into 10 languages): “The contribution Donna Eden has made will stand as one of the backbone studies as we lay a sound foundation for the field of holistic medicine.”

A deeply loving and joyful personality, Donna has treated over 10,000 clients individually and has taught hundreds of classes, speaking to packed houses throughout the United States, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, and South America. She is widely recognized for her in-born ability to clairvoyantly see the body’s energies, to track down the causes of physical and psychological problems based on the state of those energies, and to devise highly effective treatments. In addition to Energy Medicine, she is co-author of the acclaimed Promise of Energy Psychology, and she has produced more than a dozen videotaped or multimedia programs on energy medicine, ranging from the Introduction to Energy Medicine DVD to The Energies of Love DVD to The Energy Medicine Kit (a One Spirit Selection).

She is the author of Dr. Marcia Emery’s Intuition Workbook: An Expert’s Guide To Unlocking the Wisdom of Your Subconscious Mind, The Intuitive Healer: Accessing Your Inner Physician, POWERHUNCH! and Living An Intuitive Life.

In 1984, at Aquinas College in Grand Rapids, Michigan, Dr. Emery pioneered the first-of-its-kind college course in “whole brain thinking”—targeting Master of Management candidates from leading international corporations, government, and small business—thereby launching the first wave of decision-makers formally trained in intuition technology. Currently, she is an Assistant Professor at Holos University and is also on the faculty of the Kaiser Institute’s Program for Intuition, the Holmes Institute’s Graduate School of Consciousness Studies; and the University of Philosophical Studies Consciousness degree program.

Emery’s work has twice garnered grants from Minnesota-based Life Science Foundation. The first, in 1997, to establish a worldwide network of local intuition study groups under the name INREACHING and, then in 1991, to develop course materials for teaching intuitive skills and to facilitate research on the use of intuition among leading business executives.

He continued with doctoral studies at the University of California, San Diego, studying and assistant teaching in developmental biology, neurobiology, nutrition, genetics, cell biology, and molecular genetics. Thesis work focused on molecular signaling events regulating the onset of differentiation and cell type choice in the simple eucaryote Dictyostelium discoidium. He received his PhD in Biology at UCSD in 1992. Next, with an American Cancer Society Grant, he undertook three and a half years of postdoctoral work in cell signaling and cytoskeletal regulation at the Salk Institute for Biological Studies. He is currently a Research Scientist at the company Exelixis, Inc.

In parallel with the science and research training he has been a student of yoga since 1984, primarily practicing the asana and pranayama series of Astanga yoga. He began teaching yoga in 1999.

Stanley holds faculty appointments at the California Institute of Integral Studies. He has conducted workshops and seminars on dreams and/or hypnosis the world over. He is a Fellow of the Society for the Scientific Study of Religion and has published cross-cultural studies on spiritual content in dreams. He is the co-editor of the award-winning book The Varieties of Anomalous Experience and is co-author of the award-winning book Personal Mythology. He is also co-author of The Voice of Rolling Thunder, The Shamanic Powers of Rolling Thunder, Extraordinary Dreams and How to Work with Them, and PTSD: Biography of a Disease. He is co-editor of ten volumes of Advances in Parapsychological Research.

In 2002, the American Psychological Association awarded Professor Krippner the coveted “Distinguished Contribution to the International Advancement of Psychology” Award and published an article describing the substantial impact he had already made at that point.

Throughout her career Dr. McDougall has become a nationally recognized expert, speaker and community educator and has been featured in Vogue magazine and many documentaries on Integrative Medicine. As a medical student at the University of Minnesota, Dr. McDougall organized educational symposia on Integrative Medicine for the allopathic community, planned interdisciplinary health science curricula on Integrative Medicine, and helped start a university department that coordinated research, clinical services, and education in spirituality, cross-cultural medicine, and Integrative Medicine. For these and other efforts, Dr. McDougall was honored by the American Holistic Medical Association.

Most recently Dr. McDougall has immersed herself in the study of the healing properties of water as she has found purified, structured water to be fundamental to cellular vitality and the communication and coordination of information throughout the body. She is currently forming a company that marries the most effective water purification technology with the most studied water structuring technology in the world.

She is a practicing intuitive, a psychiatrist, and an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at UCLA with a private practice in Los Angeles. She leads workshops on the interrelationship of intuition, energy, and medicine.

Transforming the face of psychiatry, Dr. Judith Orloff asserts that we are keepers of an innate intuitive intelligence so perceptive that it can tell us how to heal - and prevent - illness. Yet intuition and spirituality are the very aspects of our wisdom usually disenfranchised from traditional health care.

In response, Dr. Orloff advocates "a democracy of healing," wherein every aspect of our being is granted a vote in the search for total health. It is our birthright, both as health-care givers and health-care recipients, to reclaim our intuition, restore it to full standing in the medical realm and thereby carry medicine into the future. The field of medical intuition will also be an integral part of that future.

Dr. Reed did his medical residency at Johns Hopkins. He has also provided consultation and contract services for various government agencies, including the Department of Health and Human Services and the National Institutes of Health. Dr. Reed is the current and founding president of the World Institute for Scientific Exploration (WISE), which is a tax exempt, non-profit organization. The primary mission of WISE is to conduct and promote groundbreaking scientific research on alternative medicine therapies, including energy medicine, consciousness and parapsychology, scientific anomalies, and unexplained phenomena of all kinds. But a secondary mission is to go beyond just research and to develop very innovative technologies and services, based on that research, that will significantly benefit humanity.

WISE has numerous programs, but one of its top priorities is to identify, digitize, and preserve books, periodicals, archival materials, and collections on the above subjects, especially in the biomedical field, and to provide a global platform through the WISE Wiki and the WISE Digital Library, whereby such materials can be made freely available to researchers worldwide.

Over the past seven years, Len has guided the development of an integrative, holistic model of healthcare that is focused on wellness and prevention. In order to accomplish this mission, in 1995 Len founded the Health Medicine Forum, which he continues to direct. “The Forum” is a non-profit educational foundation that has sponsored more than 150 public and professional events, including monthly presentations, workshops, and conferences. In 2001 Len co-founded the Health Medicine Institute, an integrative medicine center in Lafayette, California that is bringing the model of Health Medicine into clinical practice.

Active in public and professional education, Len has developed and moderated more than 200 events. Over the past eight years he has hosted more than 350 radio shows and appeared in dozens of television broadcasts. He has also made more than 50 presentations to hospitals, medical schools, universities, and community organizations. He has edited five books and has contributed dozens of articles and chapters on topics in complementary and alternative medicine.

She has a master's in organizational development and more than 20 years of program development experience in nonprofit, educational and service organizations, including the San Francisco Education Fund, California Pacific Medical Center, and the Sonoma Waldorf School. Stewart as administrative director for the Program in Medicine and Philosophy at California Pacific, which in 1994 became the core program of the Institute for Health & Healing.

Ms. Tolson has been implementing a compassionate and comprehensive program that provides opportunities for deep healing. Programs include the Health & Healing Center, Clinic, Classes, Support Groups, Workshops, Library, Health Information Research, In-Hospital Services, and the Certificate Program in Integrative Medicine and Spirituality. Under her direction, California Pacific established its first complementary medicine community benefit program, which reaches the poor in San Francisco.

Ms. Tolson says, "The Institute is about broadening and deepening the meaning of both health and healing. We bring together spiritual care and medical care so the whole person is supported in their healing journey. This is what good medicine is about - developing a healing relationship with each individual patient."
